reviewText:
Nice core, but this is still bare bones.
Bare bones visuals, content and basic engine functionality,
Everything seems to work decently.
Lightings and visuals seem decent, but the engine still needs fine tuning for exempliary gameplay.

Basic online code seems to work,
albeit LAN will perhaps truly tell.

As an open project,
fov slider up to 110 degrees,
resfresh rate at least to 144hz

The editor has good potential!
Reminds me of UE4.

Interesting to see where this evolves.

reviewText:
Pros:
- One of the probably best settings menu for the user I've ever seen, so I don't need to be looking at the appdata/my document folders to change stuff I want
- Editor, with ability to do a lot of stuff
- Ability to host your server with your own map, and join freely those servers
- Tons of options loaded in the game (Music Player, Record player)

Cons/Feedback:
- No Crosshair visible for the 3rd person mode
- Netplay, feels very laggy tho I wasn't able to connect european server I guess (only american and asian probably judging by ping over 100ms )... It also might be the thing with the default settings for the netplay so I guess it's hard to say for me,
- Performance -> when shooting smoke tends to make the gameplay stutter, which is very bad for the FPS game where you look for rather smooth gameplay,
- Lack of diversity in weapons -> While you have ability to change terrain on which you play, there are only 3 weapons - Gun,Rifle and Mine... it lacks melee attack which is in every game of this genre,
- Animation doesn't seem like matching between 3rd and 1st person mode while running,
- UI needs some polish... It feels like it was pretty much template and it stayed that way, Feels kinda same with background screen being the sky with stars but no object where player can keep his eyes on, I feel like putting the big Ubergame text in the middle instead of lower left corner would make it look better,
- Offline Documentation view for torque doesn't seem to work
- default input settings seems to be strange, specifically : Throw button (alt g), 1st/3rd Person Switch mode (f3), no input settings for the weapons on numbers (even to you're able to change them by using 1"
recommended:
3)
- using "3" (which I guess was supposed to be mine weapon?) at the start of the game instead of mine makes me see the assault rifle model weapon with ammo of 1/0 which I can't use. I guess I shouldn't be able even to do that. "0" makes me dequip any weapon I had
- You could add FPS in general settings for the game (to make it easier to see if you have enough fps and not be troubled by using the hotkeys for the casual players to see if they're playing with smooth FPS


As a player I can't really recommend this game (at least yet)
hoursPlayed: but as a Volunteer project I guess it's still pretty good stuff seeing that it's probably closer alpha rather than beta."

reviewText: A game that transports you back to the good ole days. As you play through the current deathmatch game mode you might reminisce about playing Goldeneye on your N64. This game does not need complex physics, in depth kit creation, and kill streak rewards to have fun. It just needs a machine gun, a pistol, and some explosives to take you back to the time before the big name publishers ruined the First Person Shooter genre with their money grubbing approach. You might ask yourself What is the point?" This is a video game the point is to have fun. To kick back after work or school with your squad
recommended: and this game achieves that. While testing the game for three hours my friends and I had a blast. The game was by far the most fun we have had since the days of minecraft.\n\nThe gameplay is good
hoursPlayed: but the best part of this game is the developer. Duion cares about his community. He made the game open source and put in a level editor
voteText: so that the community wouldn't be restricted to bland proprietary maps like in other FPS games like Call of Duty series. Developers like Duion is why I prefer indie games over games published by the bigger names like Activision
votesHelpful: and Ubisoft.\n\nIf you are looking for a new game that is a change of pace from the typical gaming experience
votesTotal: or you are looking for a game to play with you squad either online or at LAN parties I highly recommend this game. If you stick with it through the bugs
votesFunny: and the occasional crashes. I promise it will be more fun than you would ever imagine.\n"

reviewText:
You know what, I'll play devil's advocate here: I've seen and played worse.

This game, while lacking in content and a community, has potential.

Patience is a virtue people. Learn it.

This game, when it has a workshop integrated, more base content, and a larger community, I foresee being much better. If the developer is correct in that everything is moddable, we could have entirely different  games  come out of this. That's a farfetched concept, I understand, but never underestimate those talented modders out there.

Give it time, and hope that the cards are played right, and this game could be amazing.

reviewText:
What I like: The idea behind the game, its a cool fun shooter that has some real potential if people feel up to making it that. I played for maybe 10 minutes and i like it a lot.

What I didnt like: This list is a lot longer, when I played for the brief time I instantly noticed how snappy the controls are. The looking is so quick you can turn around just by barely moving your mouse. The editor is also hard to use. Maybe a I'm just dumb but it felt really complicated without any instructions (by the way, there was no tutorial).

Verdict: Buy this game and try it out, maybe it'll get worked on and reach its full potential and no longer be free. Who knows? As of now this game is bad but has some very promising outlooks if the developers stick with it and help the players along with learning the controls.

reviewText:
Ignore the negative reviews, as at this stage, they're no reliable. The game is brand new on Steam, it's still in its early stages, and of course there is not yet a dedicated fanbase; all to be expected.

Yes, the game right now is poorly optimized, and there is little content; such is to be expected with such a new game. Think of it like a child: new and developing, weak and defenseless. You wouldn't so harshly critizize a child before it utters its first word; the same mentality applies here.

Overall, the game has no original concept, but it might be a good foundation for community modding and such, and it has potential like any other early title. All I'm saying is, before posting positive or negative reviews, give it time to grow. As for those looking for a quick shoot 'em up, I'd recommend looking elsewhere until a few months later, unless you're a have to see it for myself" type of person.

~ For those Unturned

reviewText:
Ok, this game is VERY early access, like Pre-Alpha, however, I'm still going to review it. Like normal with my reviews, i'll score stuff 1 - 10

Graphics: 7/10: The game looks nice, and I can run it at a smooth 100 FPS with my GTX 970 and i5-4460, animations are smooth, but there's alot of grey. no color variance on the one map I played for about 10 minutes before I crashed to desktop.

Gameplay: 5/10: There's considerable latency between pushing Mouse 1, and an acutal trigger pull, I don't know if there's considerable latency in actual Ping, or what. But movement was fluid, though I could not crouch jump out of windows like I am used to in games like Gmod and such. Needs more guns though, but Open Source stuff gets more weapons as people create them, so I'm not too worried about that. It play's better than CoD or BF, that's for sure.

Sound: 5.5/10: There's no real oomph to any gunfire, but that's fine, and there's no combat music either, but Early Alpha project.

Stability: 3/10: I played for about 10 minutes before I crashed, I don't know what caused me to crash, but I did.

Map Editor: ?/10: Have not touched the Map Editor yet.

Overall: Reccomended: I'd say as the game gets more developed, and people start to notice it, it will become better, just give it time and play it off and on so it gets a bigger following!

This game is not ready at all for anyone to play.

reviewText: So I think a lot was missed during my first initial review and so I decided to go through a second time with this not so harsh.  I really enjoyed the time spending on a map which by the way all of the maps are very decent" but looking at the map list
date: shows a ton of them.. I would have stuck with a few maps and worked on them a bit more as far as adding more obsticles or choke points instead of just open planes all over the place.   "But Blooded Cyborg
recommended: all you do is camp!"  While that may be true but it gives the level more diversity to explore other areas of a map with more dynamics.  Though sometimes emptyness can be a good thing as far as how a match starts to pan out.\n\nSecondly ther isn't any options for game modes making it very boring to keep playing the same match style over and over again.  A lot of the good developers usually tend to focus on pure mechanics of a game. (How does one even begin to capture flag
hoursPlayed: or even a simple TDM?)  There are very good examples from early 2000 that I am not going to mention.  So think about game mechanics at this point forward then worry about driving your graphic development further afterwards.  Also add in reasonable achivements or goals
voteText: this also adds more replay value to your game.\n\nOverall the texture colors are very vivid and the texture resolutions are pretty standard in terms of no more than exceeding 512x512 resolution base
helpfulPercent: and the textures are using the mostly used effect known as POM.  Which is a combination of heighmap and bump textures. Fairly used in a lot of commercial AAA titles such as Crysis 3 and etc.\n\nFor the fact that only 1 developer has been working on this

*Clap* there is not going to be a certified list of compatible GPU's or CPU's that will be able to run it.. Not even in your Honda.. No.

Me using a GTX970 with an i5 4440 and 8 GB of So-Dimm memory is enough to run this instantly like   melting a block of ice-cream in the oven. So the game isn't really demanding in terms of graphics.  I would bet a 2nd gen i3 should have no problem running this all by itself.

So I know this is a long review but I think we all get the point that right now this does have a long way to go and the more time is spent working on this the better it will get.

New: Play through: https://youtu.be/4xY_iAvSsQc


Old quick play/review of the game:   https://youtu.be/ZfuxA0xz4Pw"

reviewText:
This game can be so much more! But there is just no content atm.
So i made a list for the dev's what they can add in the future.

- More guns.
- Better sounds.
- Better gfx.
- More maps.
- player vs A.I
- Leaderboards
- Skill based match making (Ranked)
- Add some skins like CS:GO to keep players active.
- Alot of updates to keep players active.
- Make it true open-world
- Bigger maps


At the current stage of the game i give it a
5/10

If the game get's some updates i give it a
7/10


And yes, This game it worth checking out. Because it has a pretty neat map editor.

reviewText:
This game is quite simple; an open world with different layouts, abandoned buildings, ruins, forests and even in a sandstorm its fun to play with the  various weapons,  a pistol, rocket launchers, mines, automatic rifles, but its all very basic, needle has to say, the game runs virtually on any PC, unless you have a bad connection this game will work with no problems in multiplayer. They managed to implement a decent  fire/hit system.
This is a game to be played with at least two or more players, or feel free to venture in every layout though there is not much to discover besize  finding all the different weapons and other drops.
Simple, effective, recommended to all with a smile.

reviewText: This game is art. Art IS this game. However, this game shouldn't be on Steam, it should be in a museum. As such, I can't fully recommend this game, as a GAME. Mainly, my complaint is that it's TOO good. The devs made the artistic choice of making a good game under the guise of a bad game. My favourite part was going down the road to see the voidless end of the map, and having it be literally barricated off, yet completely visible. 9/10 would be 10/10 if it was in a museum.

I downloaded this gamne because I thought it wouldn't be so bad... BOY was I wrong!
>Be me
>Play on a map alone to learn controls and test graphics

>Join said server and IMMEDIATELY crash
>Open game again and try again (CRASH)
>Think welp, third time's the charm
>Try again and get in
>Play for five minutes and kill three people who can't shoot for ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•
>Those 3 people couldn't aim because of the sensitivity

>writes review

reviewText:
This...this is what gunscape should have been ladies and gentlemen, You can't ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• and moan when this just now started and is clearly going to be a user driven base of content. I just now got this editor up and i now have a base game to prototype my models and objects and ugre anyone trying to build a game themself to use this as a prototyper. To the developer i can only say once you have a guide to the editor and more importing options this project can only grow.

(edit:) Side note: once a melee element is made this game will boom from the current love of the darkage books and the like given the effect on the world you can use. Swords at dusk...in a sand storm....epic..

To anyone under the age of 20: you will not like this and if your not skilled enough to make things of this sort you will not find it fun. This is a real full hearted throw back to the good old days of basics and the beauty there in. Go back to your HD-soaked ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•t FPS's kiddos.

Looking forword to the future of this game and hope that this review will bring in the few people who recall what made a good game and thats: Hard Work, Imagination, A drive to want something awesome!

reviewText: This could potentially be a good game, given the idea the developers have. However, the most detrimental thing currently is how it feels like it is closer to alpha rather than  a beta. With enough development in polish, this could be a really fun game, because people love hosing custom matches with unique maps, etc. There are only 3 weapons, iffy animations, and an unpolished UI. I, personally, would much rather have come across this game as Early Access, but I will still keep an eye on its development. This could be a really cool game if the devs continue to put effort into it. I will still mark that I recommend this game because it is a cool concept and I support it, with hopes it will further develop into a more complete experience.

reviewText:
I wanted to like this game, it has so much potential, but there is so muuch wrong with it right now:
1. There isn't much content weapon-wise(and maps ar kinda plain), but that is understandable when it's being made by one guy.
2. There is almost no playerbase. It's really sad, to be honest.
3. The graphics are... ok.
4. Awkward controls, but you can edit the controls

Even with those cons, there are at least some pros:
1. It's actually free, no pay to win.
2. Open source
3. Has a built in level editor
4. Levels are expansive (take that how you wish), but that would be nice if there were more players.
5. animations are smoooth-ish, and the mechanics work well.

I would reccomend this game if you like free, and you like to play with a few friends at the same time. otherwise, this game has no playerbase whasoever.

reviewText: I got this game a few days ago and I like it. I've played on it abit with a couple friends and they like it too. The dev IS adding and changing things. I didn't think so at first, but when I logged on today to play a quick 1 on 1 match or two with my friend, I noticed that alot had been changed and for the better I think. Yes it is true the game is a bit laggy on lower end riggs but I play on all uber settings and still do not lag. I think it could use a bit more content but the game has lots of potential and is free. I give it an 8/10 due to a VERY low player base, but I have seen other players on besides me and my friends. Nice game dev and keep up the good work!

reviewText:
Product received for free

Well, I gotta admit this game is pretty Ueber.

6/10

Would join a bunch of empty servers again.

Uebergame is a Free to Play Open Source First Person Shooter created by one man. Given that fact my opinion on the whole game is pretty mixed at this point because of how MEH" this game feels. I say this game is "Meh" because when I played the game I did the options to max settings to see if I could run the game at those settings. I was suprised to find that the game ran actually pretty horrible for me frame rate wise at 20-30 frames per second and when ever I fired my gun the frame rate dropped by 10 frames. So I changed my settings to Open GL
date: no V-Sync and the lowest possible graphics settings. Still
recommended:
I got a pretty low frame rate and even some missing textures. I even went on a server and the game froze and crashed after one minute. I don't know why I can't run it that well because I can run The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim fine.

It's an okay game and I would say give it a chance if you are interested in it like I was.

But go in it knowing that:

1. The game is pretty much dead and nobody plays it.

2. This game needs a lot of work for it to go from just an okay game to a good game. Maybe soon when the Developer keeps updating the game it will turn out to be good but for now it's just an okay game.

Also a tip for starting the game: Bring friends!"
